content.description: Sit start with a right hand pulling on the arete and a left hand pushing out. From there, climb straight up the sharp arete using a series of pinches and a sidepull to reach a mantle finish.
content.protection: A pad will work well, the landing is fantastic.
content.location: It climbs the southwest arete of Cock Block.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the large jug. From there, move up and left to a rounded edge, then traverse left to the rail, at the rail, gain the lip, traverse right to the apex, throw a heel over, and mantle onto the boulder.
content.protection: A pad will work fine, the landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Cock Block.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the big jug feature. From there, move to a right hand sidepull, then move to a high left hand sidepull, follow with both hand to the sloping lip, traverse left up to the apex, throw a heel over, and mantle atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pad will work fine, the landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Cock Block.

content.description: Sit start with a sloping left hand edge and a low right hand edge below the overhang. From there, gain a right hand edge, then pull up to a left hand edge-gaston, bump the left hand to the arete, bring the right over to the edge just used by the left, stand up on the start hold and reach a bump, mantle atop the slab, and finish up the remainder for the send.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is very good, but there is a tree trunk behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Cock Block.
